website_summaries.verdict: An affordable guitar by Yamaha that is likely to please beginners and occasional players with its notable sound.
pros: Delivers bold, clear sound that is characteristic of guitars from Yamaha's 800 series
cons: Feels lightweight, which may concern experienced players

customer_reviews.title: REMEMBER TO STRETCH THE STRINGS!
customer_reviews.text: This guitar is an super-ok guitar, i have 0 complaints, $150 well spent, only thing you have to remember is they do not stretch the strings so when you get the guitar and tune it, you have to stretch the strings yourself, i didnt know that and was getting bad buzzing from my E string, but after realizing the strings were not stretched i stretched and re-tuned and the guitar sounds 100 times better! just thought id share that with the rest of you.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: this is a very nice product. It both looks and sounds very nice
customer_reviews.text: For an entry level acoustic guitar, this is a very nice product. It both looks and sounds very nice. If you are a beginner, as I am, it is very important to have this guitar set up by a professional. The action from the factory is quite high and frustrating if you're new to guitar. Lowering the bridge and filing the nut, in addition to new strings, completely changes it and makes it so much easier to play.
customer_reviews.author: Dixie

customer_reviews.title: Massively better than I expected for the price
customer_reviews.text: Massively better than I expected for the price. Bought the guitar based on reviews. Haven't played (multiple reasons) for several years. Have owned several top end guitars, but just wanted something to play, out on the porch, at night. The sound is amazing. I did put lighter gauge strings on it, and lower the action just a bit. But a few bucks of added expense makes it play several hundred dollars better. .. impressed, even as it came out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Mason

customer_reviews.title: Great guitar. I was worried about ordering it online ...
customer_reviews.text: Great guitar. I was worried about ordering it online but it came perfect. It has a crisp, full sound plugged and unplugged. Out of all the guitars I looked at between $300-500 this had the best sound, at least in my opinion. I use it to perform all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Scott C.

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha is the "Toyota Camry" for instruments
customer_reviews.text: The sound is really warm, the strings are close to the fret so it's easier on the fingers, the tuning was a breeze and you can really feel the quality of the product. I got mine used with a quarter size dent on the back, but even then, the sound quality is high, especially for the price. You can't go wrong if you want a cheap guitar with a good quality build and sound.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha FG800 Solid Top Acoustic Guitar
customer_reviews.text: Don't be fooled by reviews on this site or searching the internet. This guitar is really cheap and weighs about as much as a magazine. It does sound good but it is ONLY for beginners. Just be careful that you do not break it. There are much better acoustic guitars for the same or a little more than this guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A.

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing little guitar. The action is a little high, but if you spend an extra $30 dollars at guitar center having them set it up correctly and adjust the action for you (takes about 20 minutes) You end up with a guitar worth much much more than $200. I played this and compared it to a $900 Martin guitar. This blew away the Martin. It was louder richer and the strings rang and sustained longer and richer. I am blown away, no, completely blown away. I find myself wanting to play this guitar every single day, without finger fatigue. I recommend replacing the strings with some good strings. It's worth it. Completely happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: CR

customer_reviews.title: Poor customer support
customer_reviews.text: While this guitar is supposed to be good for beginners, it is likely to have manufacturing defects (you get what you pay for). The painful part is that when you discover it and take it to Yamaha, while they are supportive, they are extraordinarily slow (it is already 3 weeks for me and I have no ETA on the replacement) in replacing it (and offer no guarantees on quality check for the replacement) I'd recommend purchasing a guitar from another manufacturer for your own peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Sanil Jain

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Got a budget? Don't waste a lot of money of those top brands out there. Get this Yamaha Fg800 .Best sounding Guitar out there. Consider I upgrade a lot of hardware though. To the top pick up out there Lr Baggs Lyric acoustic microphone, to Groover tuning heads ,a hard case accessories. I did add sticker inlays. So far so good .
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Can't put it down! Love at first sight.
customer_reviews.text: I love this guitar. It's even prettier in person and plays so nicely. I'm used to cheap guitars that are usually a letdown, but I've never been let down my Yamaha. And now this guitar is the best I own. I can't put it down, it's just so nice to hold. Shipping was super fast, arrived a day early. I was nervous about ordering from Amazon without trying it, but everything is perfect. I couldn't be happier with this guitar.
customer_reviews.author: J. C.

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I've played quite a few fiddles in this price range, Most of them sound like a cardboard box but the fs800 surprised me. The action was decent out of the box and the frets were fairly decent. Only real problems i had with it was the fact that it was smaller than i thought it would be and that the top wood had some blemishes but other than that i would say that it was money well spent. forgot to mention the strings that come on it are terrible, replace them immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Hornsby

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: There is no other words to describe this guitar, it is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Henrique Ellrich

customer_reviews.title: great guitar still
customer_reviews.text: I got this a few months ago. The wood is stable and the guitar plays like a $900 guitar from 8 years ago. The quality is amazing for the money. Frankly it doesn't even make sense to spend much more than this on a guitar anymore. I did upgrade the nut and saddle to bone ones and the tone was noticeably improved. I also replaced the bridge pins with ones that I thought were prettier... they made no tone difference. I was slightly disappointed in the Chinese manufacturing location but frankly its just a place. The quality is there so I don't know how anybody could complain.
customer_reviews.author: Privacy is nice

customer_reviews.title: Great for our teen daughter
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our teenage daughter for her birthday and she loves it. A super beginner guitar that sounds great and is very playable.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Hall, MCC

customer_reviews.title: In love with this baby
customer_reviews.text: I love this guitar. I tweaked nothing. Even tho many reviewers almost persuade me to go do many changes, this guitar sounded amazing out of the box. I'm not a pro guitar player, but to my musician's ears, this thing sounds very beautiful. Play it every day and couldn't be more happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: DJ TOFI

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and sound, needs tweaking
customer_reviews.text: This guitar has a very good bold sound and build (excellent value), I ordered a string upgrade, D'Addario EJ15 Phosphor Bronze Acoustic Guitar Strings (the stock strings were too thick for me), and and it plays real smooth now, stays in tune after breaking in. The built-in tuner which works perfectly on mine, makes this guitar a no-brainer for $300.
customer_reviews.author: W

customer_reviews.title: Guitar looks good. Good finish and sound
customer_reviews.text: I am not an expert. Guitar looks good. Good finish and sound. Strings are low and easy to fret. Only required tuning out of box. Packaging is poor quality. Had to return first one due to transit damage. The second one also had damage to box but guitar was ok
customer_reviews.author: Cw-user

customer_reviews.title: I love this guitar
customer_reviews.text: Excellent guitar! I've had it for about 6 months now, mine arrived in great shape, and it's been great to play. I'm a TOTAL beginner, and while acoustics are harder to start with (electric is easier), I trust it'll make me a better player in the long run. Have a buddy who is a total guitar head, probably buys a new guitar every few months just to own it. He's offered to buy mine lol, says it's better than the acoustic he has (he's mostly electric). I'm not selling it though, this thing is mine.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful guitar
customer_reviews.text: This guitar is perfect for anyone wanting to learn. I’m petite and so the size of this one isn’t too intimidating for me. It came in brand new perfect condition and just looked beautiful and shiny out of the box. I used Guitar Tuna app to tune it, which was awesome. Also bought the Axe pack accessory kit to go with it. Highly recommend this for anyone wanting to learn or been playing.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: I think it sounds very good. Solid guitar. Looks tough too. The finish on the wood is quite all right. It does sound better than rogue but I think a rogue would be sufficient for a beginner. I've kept this because I enjoy the feeling and the sound of this guitar. The rogue is now in the living room free to use for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Aldee

customer_reviews.title: Best guitar for under $200!
customer_reviews.text: Great starter guitar and a great value for guitar under $200. The treble sounds clear and bright, while the bass resonates well. Tuning is quick and easy, and it stays tuned for a while. If you're a guitar hobbyist, you can't go wrong with this one.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: This guitar is the perfect size if a regular size guitar is a little ...
customer_reviews.text: This guitar is the perfect size if a regular size guitar is a little to large. This instrument sounds and looks beautiful and is very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful clear sound. Well made. Great price!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a surprise for my hubs. Beautiful clear sound. Very well made and at a super price you can’t beat! Great for someone who has played for years and also beginners. You know what they say.... girls love a guy who can play a guitar!!! We are loving it!!
customer_reviews.author: Jami Tartaglione Wood

customer_reviews.title: Love the size.
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this guitar.I can't play yet but it fits really nice, with the smaller body. Looks like a new classic. Don't misunderstand me when I say small body , it's full size.
customer_reviews.author: julie

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING value - great guitar
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my fiancé for Christmas and he LOVES it. I was so nervous that I wasn’t getting him a “nice enough” one or that I should be looking at well known guitar brands such as Gibson or Fender. This plays wonderfully though. You would have thought that I spent upwards of $1000 on this, not $300-400. It’s very sturdy, and plays beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin W

customer_reviews.title: FS800 Sounds Better
customer_reviews.text: This is essentially supposed to be the same as the FS800 with the exception of the cutaway and onboard electronics but it does not sound the same. The sound on the standard FS800 is much richer. Had to return this.
customer_reviews.author: Jose G Torres Jr

customer_reviews.title: A good Guitar
customer_reviews.text: First, I am a beginner for guitar. I have done a lot of research before buying this one. Very good quality. Very easy to adjust the tune for beginners like me. The sound quality is also very good. FS800 is smaller/shorter and is a better choice for beginners than FG800. BTW, for beginners, you also need to buy a tune that can be attached on the guitar to help you remember the name of each note. You also need a bag for it. I also bought a guitar stand.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 13 year old learning guitar for 3 years
customer_reviews.text: Arrived well-packaged. Bought this for my 13 year old son who has been taking guitar lessons for 3 years. His instructor said this was a good choice for his skill level and the price point was right for me. It certainly produces a much richer, smoother sound than his first guitar. He is still not quite careful enough with his guitar (or electronics) for me to invest in a more expensive instrument at his age.
customer_reviews.author: mac101

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: i got same model like 13 years ago, still got it and it plays great. i ordered one for my girlfriends dad, same great quality he loves it. i highly recomend for beginers. its cheap, easy to play and sounds great! 🤘🏻
customer_reviews.author: EViLDaD

customer_reviews.title: It keeps it's tune surprisingly well
customer_reviews.text: I've had this guitar for over a year, and I think I've only tuned it maybe two times? Mind you, I don't play it all the time, but still that pretty incredible. This guitar has an incredible sound, much richer in the low end than many other guitars I've heard.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Sz.

customer_reviews.title: good guitar
customer_reviews.text: low action easy to play. In the pic Yamaha left, martin0015, taylor 12e concert, taylor 214.
customer_reviews.author: steve w.

customer_reviews.title: Decent value for the money. Shipping box damaged.
customer_reviews.text: Decent value for the money. I needed an inexpensive acoustic to use in recording layered acoustic gtr. I put 12 string strings on lower strings for “Nashville tuning.” Poor man’s 12 string! Worked well for that. Other than that I’d say it’s a good beginners to intermediate players’ gtr.
customer_reviews.author: David Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Awesome guitar! Once I got it and set it ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome guitar! Once I got it and set it up with lower action and intonation, it plays like a dream!
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Miller

customer_reviews.title: The sound of the guitar
customer_reviews.text: I am just learning to play the guitar, and was advised to start with a good a well made guitar. The FG800 Yamaha fits the bill nicely. I am enjoying learning on this guitar. I would recommend this guitar to anyone looking for a good guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Would Buy it Again
customer_reviews.text: For a 200 dollar guitar it plays like it is 10 times that price as the craftsmanship is superb.. Brilliant sound with the solid top, neck profile is super comfy, and is just inspiring to play. Yamaha, keep it up, customer for life!
customer_reviews.author: Jack T

customer_reviews.title: Really solid guitar for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For a $200 guitar you can't beat it. Could use a set up as action is a little high up the neck. Minor truss rod adjustment got mine right where I like it. The only issue I had was the neck could have been better sanded mine has some rough spots on it. Doesn't affect playability as its in spots I'll never touch when playing but still bothers me. Mostly because it sounds so good and the finish should match the playability and sound. Overall super happy with this guitar.
customer_reviews.author: John Slone

customer_reviews.title: Over rated on here
customer_reviews.text: Generally well built Iffy tuners Neck finish poor Good but toylike
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: Very playable right out of the box.  Amazing sound
customer_reviews.text: Very playable right out of the box. Amazing sound, Compare to Taylor 214ce. I actually think the Taylor 214ce doesn’t sound as good as this yamaha. I know this sounds to good to be true but be sure you play this guitar and compare for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Lovett

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable Price and Sounds Good - Sent Me A Severely Damaged Package
customer_reviews.text: Reasonable price. Good sound. My son loves it. Cons: Amazon sent mine with the original severely damaged. The content was alright. Not too happy as I planned to give this guitar as a birthday gift.
customer_reviews.author: CyberChang

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: Very poorly made, not even a finish on it, don't bother.
customer_reviews.author: Berry

customer_reviews.title: Great Guitar!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely one of the best beginner guitars on the market, I've ordered 3 of them for me and each of my kids and they ALL come ready to go, no need to adjust truss rods or lower action they set up good out of the box. And sound great very bright tones and have alot sustain. I highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Smith

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great.
customer_reviews.text: There is some Yamaha quality control issue with these guitars on . First one had a bubble on the side near the neck, second one had a dent on the top, to avoid the hazzle I acepted a partial refund and keep the guitar. Other than that it sounds great and looks beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Jose A. Colon Ayala

customer_reviews.title: An excellent guitar!
customer_reviews.text: No dislikes! Excellent sound, holds its tuning very well, thin neck so it's very suitable for medium and small hands. It has a simple design but attractive. I really like mine!
customer_reviews.author: Capricorn54

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for a beginner up to intermediate.
customer_reviews.text: This guitar is an excellent value for someone looking for an entry level guitar that they can play for a couple of years until they are ready to invest some money in something a little nicer. The quality and sound are exceptional for the price. I don't think you can get a nicer guitar for the money. I would recommend pairing this with the Yamaha AG1-HC Hard Case, which is also a great value and a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: Scot

customer_reviews.title: The perfect beginner guitar
customer_reviews.text: Great guitar for this price point. It has all the features you need while also being inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginner and pros alike...
customer_reviews.text: Great sounds, works right out of the box. Definitely great guitar for beginner. For the pros out there, if you don't want to carry your expensive gear everywhere, this is the great back-up guitar. One that 5 times the cost not necessary sounds 5 times better. Cheers.
customer_reviews.author: Jay. D

customer_reviews.title: Qualityn  value
customer_reviews.text: Was for my son for xmas so cant answer more. He not a beginner
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great guitar for the money
customer_reviews.text: For the money there's no better guitar out there. I'd recommed this to every beginner and even some experienced players looking for something that can get beat around a little bit.
customer_reviews.author: D. P. Mapes

customer_reviews.title: This guitar was made in CHINA.
customer_reviews.text: I have NEVER seen a quality string instrument from CHINA. This one is no exception. Although the guitar's physical size agreed with me, the action was high and the finish on the neck was poorly done, so much so that the neck not only looked bad but felt rough to the touch as well. I chose to reject and return this Yamaha FSX800C.
customer_reviews.author: Veteran

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful instrument. I had to change the strings but ...
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful instrument. I had to change the strings but the build quality and sound are all here. For this price point you can't go wrong. Yamaha has done a really nice job here. I'll be buying a second one soon.
customer_reviews.author: Emerson

customer_reviews.title: ... a military family stationed overseas) and it arrived in awesome condition! It is exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I had it shipped alllllll the way to my PO box in South Korea (we are a military family stationed overseas) and it arrived in awesome condition! It is exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: E. Zinnia

customer_reviews.title: Good sound
customer_reviews.text: Still learning to play but it sounds great and from the novice point of view this is a great guitar that I can grow my talent into. Not a cheap student throw away.
customer_reviews.author: Odies mom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent guitar. I was going to buy something cheaper ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent guitar. I was going to buy something cheaper but the quality you get for the price you pay is unmatchable. Packaging was good too.
customer_reviews.author: S. Haji

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: Simply the best acoustic guitar I've played under $500. Great tone. Good action. Mine doesn't have ANY fret buzz which is uncommon for a budget guitar. Fretting doesn't even really feel like an acoustic.
customer_reviews.author: Guy That Buys Stuff

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: The sound of this guitar is amazing! Great for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Sandip Subedi

customer_reviews.title: Nice beginner guitar at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Nice guitar solid feel and looks great. As a beginner I’m finding this guitar easy to play while making progress in my quest to play guitar. I anticipate playing this guitar for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S

customer_reviews.title: Excellent starter guitar, with a few modifications
customer_reviews.text: This is a good acoustic guitar, especially for those just learning. It does need a setup almost immediately, which most guitar shops do. The stock strings are only okay, and an upgrade to Elixir Strings 80/20 Bronze Acoustic Guitar Strings will make a huge difference. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: NorCal2NYC

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha FG800
customer_reviews.text: Yamaha probably makes the best acoustic guitars for a cheap price. You can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: A really solid guitar
customer_reviews.text: I bought this nearly 3 years ago as my first guitar. I've put a lot of play into it since then and it still performs perfectly. Still really enjoy playing it, and it really is a good guitar for the price. I'd really recommend it for a beginner's or budget acoustic guitar.. I'm sure there are some better out there, but I have almost never thought about upgrading it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fine guitar.
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Good looking. Excellent playability. I have heard better sounding guitars but not at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I learned to play guitar when I was about 10. I am sixteen now and decided it was time for a new one, this guitar is the perfect size as well as sound. Very beautiful and well made, I definitely recommend to anyone new to playing or intermediate players.
customer_reviews.author: debbie lostaunau

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: My wife absolutely lives this guitar. The first one we got was completely destroyed in shipping, but Amazon sent out another right away. The reviews weren't wrong, this thing is worth more than the asking price. Best bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Justin

customer_reviews.title: my first guitar
customer_reviews.text: I dont know much about guitars but i do know this one is beautiful and from what i can tell sounds amazing. I'm really enjoying learning on it!
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful guitar
customer_reviews.text: Very nice guitar, I bought the small amp also. Nice quality for the money
customer_reviews.author: Ray Styles

customer_reviews.title: Great guitar for great price
customer_reviews.text: What a great guitar for such a good price. Sounds great and hard to find quality at this price. Would buy again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: J. Simons

customer_reviews.title: Great axe for the $$
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice guitar for the money. It is my first electric-acoustic and it meets or exceeds my expectations in every way. Sounds great out of a small floor amp and great when it's not plugged in! Yamaha FTW!
customer_reviews.author: O'Timisout

customer_reviews.title: Pick Guard trouble with top layer
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful full sound. Feels good and easy to play. But I’m not sure what to do about the pick guard. The top coating seems to be bubbling and peeling up around the edges. Not sure what to do about it.
customer_reviews.author: M.J.McCRADY

customer_reviews.title: Great Starter Guitar
customer_reviews.text: I haven't picked up a guitar in years. But this is a great guitar to re learn or for starters wanting to play.
customer_reviews.author: david resenbeck

customer_reviews.title: It is good, but there is better.
customer_reviews.text: If you play rhythm. I would recommend fg830. But this guitar sounds good too!
customer_reviews.author: Ertugrul E.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best guitar in this price range by a long ways.
customer_reviews.author: G.C.

customer_reviews.title: Acoustic Electric Guitar
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, but the sound is not loud enough if using with no Amp.
customer_reviews.author: Yobkris

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality!!! 2nd one I have bought
customer_reviews.text: Sound is loud and clear. Plugged in and unplugged great sound. Smooth neck for easier playing. I can’t complain! Great quality product!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good, solid sound and expert craftmanship
customer_reviews.text: Good, solid sound and expert craftmanship. The " blemishes" give the guitar a unique look and in no way detract from the sound. An excellent find for those that are not obsessed with perfection.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Shearer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing guitar
customer_reviews.text: This guitar is sweeeet. It sounds amazing. Well worth the money. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Jager

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant sounding guitar for the price
customer_reviews.text: Guitar is well made, has easy to use electronics, and most importantly sounds amazing. Better than anything in the price range.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Howard

customer_reviews.title: Purchased Returned guitar-perfect
customer_reviews.text: Knowing Amazon's easy return policy, I took a chance on the Yamaha FG800 that had been returned. The guitar is perfect condition $170 and perfect for my beginner level of experience.
customer_reviews.author: lpadgett

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving this guitar. The value alone is worth giving it a look. The sound is great, I have no buzz, and the action is super smooth. Don't question it, just buy it....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This guitar is awesome. It always stays in tune.that's a Yamaha for ya!
customer_reviews.author: edward

customer_reviews.title: Great Guitar but need to change string
customer_reviews.text: I bought this guitar for my beginning guitar class, my professor tested it and said it is a great guitar for beginner. Only thing you need to do is change a easy-play string when you get it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality guitar
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a high quality guitar for the price. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: csp24

customer_reviews.title: Excellent service, great guitar
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this guitar on June 30th. (from West Music in Coralville, IA through Amazon.) The guitar was shipped the next day through UPS and was delivered to me in south central Virgina on Friday, July 3rd in perfect condition. I'm very well pleased with the guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Francis

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful first guitar
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful guitar. My son loves it. It’s his first and the sound is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne NJ

customer_reviews.title: Great first guitar!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great guitar so far and the quality of construction is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Rich F

customer_reviews.title: Very nice & reasonably priced!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my girlfriend as a beginner guitar, but this little gem plays super well! Nice feel, great sound. I might just have to keep it for myself! Lol!
customer_reviews.author: Moose

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: Someone brought one of these guitars into my recording studio and I loved it. Bought one for myself and it's getting a lot of use. Very good for recording and comfortable to play.
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, high quality instrument!
customer_reviews.text: This guitar did not disappoint. Beautiful, and excellent sound quality at a reasonable price. Super fast shipping and safely boxed. 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Mme Wheaton

customer_reviews.title: Glad I Bought It
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful guitar. Plays great. Sounds wonderful. Quality instrument. A joy to play.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny's girl

customer_reviews.title: Wow..pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a travel/beater guitar and haven't put it down! Absolutely amazing guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This guitar looks and sounds great. It is set up well and easy to play. I would suggest it to anyone wanting to learn guitar.
customer_reviews.author: H12

customer_reviews.title: took me
customer_reviews.text: Well I didn't appreciate the fact that I bought this fsx800c paid 319. and then next day I see same guitar with the kit bag, strap etc for 319. how come I didn't get that
customer_reviews.author: david voelker

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Great starter guitar.... the size makes it easy to handle and it sounds great! The instrument arrived in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good for professional recording
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great, plays great, I've been playing guitar for 16 years and it feels high quality. Also the signal I get from it is very clean, also a bonus is it uses 2 AA's instead of a 9 volt
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Richmond

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This guitar sounds like a $2000.00 guitar. Rich and clear sound. Stays tuned up. The finish on the guitar is quality. It fits and feels good in the hand. Would recommend anyone to add this guitar to their collection.
customer_reviews.author: haffoxtrot

customer_reviews.title: Great guitar
customer_reviews.text: Great guitar not only for beginners but for all. The quality is fantastic and you can’t beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: I can't say enough
customer_reviews.text: Perfect guitar at an insanely low price. Sounds beautiful, not a flaw to be found in fit and finish.
customer_reviews.author: sjs

customer_reviews.title: Nice Guitar
customer_reviews.text: The Guitar is Well packing, very good for beginner. It should last couple years

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: this is a top quality guitar for the price. I am very impressed with the sound. Well worth the money innit

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality
customer_reviews.text: No real negatives - great build quality, easy to play, great room filling sound. Holds tuning very well, machines are weill made and easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E Kampsen

customer_reviews.title: Great smaller body guitar
customer_reviews.text: This guitar was exactly what my son wanted - smaller with a good sound.

customer_reviews.title: Two enthusiastic thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: Great feel and perfect size to take anywhere, real beautiful color and is gorgeous! Perfect sound

product_meta.title: YAMAHA FS800 Small Body Solid Top Acoustic Guitar, Natural
product_meta.description: Style:Acoustic| Size:Concert| Color:Natural| Configuration:Guitar OnlyYamaha's standard acoustic model, with simple and traditional looks and outstanding quality, at an affordable price. A solid-top guitar with authentic sound that is well balanced without sacrificing its robust strength, thanks to the newly developed scalloped bracing design. Can be confidently recommended to all beginner guitarists.
feature_bullets: This guitar has an adjustable truss rod
